projects.description: Practice your knowledge of basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button.

Long lists don't make for a good user experience on a web page. In this project, we'll enhance the usability of a web page that contains a long list by employing JavaScript to dynamically divide the list into "pages". As a bonus challenge, we'll add a search feature to display only the students that match the search criteria.

Full Stack JavaScript developers create forms to collect information from users for nearly every website and application they build. For this project, you’ll use your skills to enhance a form so that it’s engaging, interactive, and easy to use.
a browser-based, word guessing game: Phrase Hunter.

projects.project_name: Use a Public API to Create an Employee Directory
projects.description: Many sites — Twitter, Facebook, IMDB, and Wikipedia to name a few — offer a vast sea of data that you can access and display on your own web pages. Using JavaScript, you’ll create an employee directory by communicating with a third-party API (Application Programming Interface).
A user friendly site that shows the latests updates for corona virus besides a new solution to make everyday shopping more safe.
